intro: Luzula sicula, commonly known as Sicilian woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses and related plants. This species typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Luzula sicula has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its botanical features make it well adapted to the specific ecological conditions of its native habitat.
